column4: hi im trying to install ubuntu on an older computer. The Live CD hasnt worked because my CD drive doesnt like it for some reason. Ive been able to make a bootable copy on my hard drive and when Ubuntu starts i click installer. However when the installer gets to the partitioner, everything is gray. Anyone have a solution?
is this the same hard drive you are using to boot off?
I thought this was the problem but I have no other way to install it....
you can't really modify a hard drive that
you can't really modify a hard drive that's in use
do you have another that you can use?
you mean install another harddrive into the computer and do it like that?
- ive tried to do it with my USB drive, but theres no option in my bios to boot from USB and the alternate CD doesnt work
is this a laptop or desktop?
what happens when you use the live cd?
it just says that the disk is unvalid. but it works on other computers just fine. Im pretty sure its something with the CD drive
could well be, do you have a cd drive you can throw in?
im trying to look for one. do you have any other way for me to get ubuntu onto my computer
i'm not sure sorry, if you have another hard drive you can throw in to put the live cd stuff on you could do it that way
yep that would be it, no worries
